author: Andre.Chagwedera
title: Africa Opensource Pharma & Medicine
description: Drug & medical funding is heavily centralised. Africa lacks investment & solutions despite native scientific talent.

author: Q U A S A R
title: ESUSU: MicroInsurance Nigeria
description: Access to many types of insurance in Nigeria is not available and unaffordable.

author: rtoky8
title: COINLAND
description: Many african countries suffer from malnutrition and food insufficiency because +50% of cultivable land are unexploited

author: Phil Lewis
title: Introducing Empowa
description: A severe housing backlog in Africa (50 million units) & lack of property wealth, compounded by financial exclusion & growing urbanisation

author: alexis.franck
title: From Plastic Waste 2 Social Housing
description: Slumdogs and plastic pollution in Ecosystems are social and environmental issues growing with the urbanization across the African continent.

author: Bobby Quinn
title: Crowdsourced map imagery w/ paypixl
description: Mapping critical resources in growing regions is critical, but difficult to do without ground truth and location-based imagery.

author: Rik
title: ADA news in African languages
description: News about Cardano should be available in native languages in African communities. However, The crypto world is English-speaking oriented

author: Abdinur
title: African launchpad
description: Africa has a high number of university graduates each year but lacks a pathway for those graduates to enter employment or start a business.

author: John Kasimba Omolo
title: Africa's Cardano Resource
description: There aren't many resources available for the East and Central African Regions

author: jason
title: Rewarding Payroll Solutions Resume
description: Resumes are biased. A more trustless system helps hiring & leads to targeted discounts. Advertising in 2021 $649b & a bad hire costs ~$240k.

author: nathansamson
title: Networking events
description: Awareness of Cardano's projects and vision are very low on the ground here among investors, young people and community leaders in Ethiopia.

author: Nebiyu
title: Cardano Student Clubs in Ethiopia
description: A Vast majority of the Ethiopian youth have never even heard of cardano and there is no active and engaged community.

author: ADD.xyz
title: ADD.xyz's DeFi Mobile Money Bridge
description: APY's of financial products in Africa has dropped from 20% to 2% APY in the past 5 years due to deflation, political corruption and covid-19

author: SimonT
title: Decentralization at Societal Level.
description: The staking experience does not make it easy to contribute to Cardano's goals of societal decentralization and support African SPO.

author: tobrien
title: No-Code For Creative Africa
description: Lack of a Pan-Africa strategy to gain a piece of the 4.07 trillion IT service Market or to meets its growing IT needs.

author: tobrien
title: Hyper-Localizable Wallet for Africa
description: Diverse personas, languages (2000+), TELCO SLAs, threat metrics, customer budgets, devices..

author: frederic.olenczak
title: E-ROW waterways transportation
description: Millions of people are commuting daily in Africa using fossil energies which makes the cost of transport high, second expense per household.

author: mearaftadewos
title: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia
description: In Ethiopia, people can't buy or cash out ADA easily. There is also no ADA payment ways and cardano users in Ethiopia, only few in Africa

author: Jonathan W.
title: ADA Liquidity for Ethiopia
description: For those in Ethiopia without access to traditional exchanges, purchasing ADA is prohibitively difficult and expensive.

author: Oluwaseun ADEPOJU
title: Teens Blockchain Summer Bootcamp
description: "In most parts of Africa, ignorance and poor education about Blockchain technology has led to a lot of misconceptions"

author: Dharma_Gardener
title: Make DApp for Worldwide Gardening!
description:
Climate has changed.

Biodiversity is suffering.

Topsoil reserves dwindling.

Poverty.

Humanity is out of sync with nature, spirit & self.

author: anneconnelly
title: Trust Graphic Novel & Motion Comic
description: Blockchain education isn't Africa-focused and often portrays Africans as the beneficiaries instead of the drivers of change.

author: Maarten Menheere
title: Paper wallet terminal for in a shop
description: People need a way to transfer fiat currency to ADA when they don't have access to a phone, electricity or bank account.

author: gregoryw
title: Sanitation Microfarming (tm) PBC
description: In Ethiopia few people have access to clean sanitation and water. At the same time Ethiopia and the rest of Africa need blockchain tech.

author: WADA(West Africa Decentralized Alliance)
title: Planting Roots In Africa
description: Best solutions will come from the ground, but African devs lack infrastructure to push Cardano forward. Cardano community support is needed.

author: Michael Solomon
title: Free WIFI For Minibus Taxis
description:
There is next to zero awareness of Cardano in South Africa.

The cost of Mobile data in South Africa is amongst the highest in the world.

author: Jonathan W.
title: First Ethiopian Stake Pool
description: There are very few stake pools in Africa and none in Ethiopia today.
